file_content.text: That's our man. Can you get us control of Balmorra's satellite system?
Not exactly. But I can shut it down, that's for sure.
That's a dangerous task for a tech.
I'm still impressed.
A fair fight is a good start.
I'm still impressed.
Shutting down a satellite system is nothing to sneeze at.
I'm still impressed.
Hacking past a Hawkeye defense? I deserve a medal!
What do you mean, not exactly?
Can you elaborate?
That's not promising.
Neither do I. Unless we have control of the system, any attack from Bugtown is going to fail.
I can get you one unauthorized command. Then the system will lock up, and it'll take the Hawkeyes weeks to detangle it.
That'll have to be enough. How do we make this happen?
The hack needs to be planted in the satellite control tower's main computers, right where Admiral Riserre and his men are stationed.
Does the admiral have any other defenses?
What should I expect?
Just his track record. Even in defeat, he always manages to strike the last blow.
There's no way to draw them out?
I don't like those odds.
Using the satellite system was the admiral's idea. He wants to keep it as badly as we want to steal it.
They won't stop me.
Once the fight's over, just insert this disc into the main control console. It'll upload the hack.
I need to get to a computer. Thanks again for the rescue.
Taking down Admiral Riserre and his men is a tall order. Are you sure you're up to it?
The admiral will surrender the satellite system, or fall defending it.
Absolutely sure.
Knowing the admiral, surrender isn't an option.
Are you sure your troops can take on the Imperial army?
Don't worry about me.
Fair enough.
Only difference between us is a whole lot of blasters.
He's just an Imperial.
Grit and determination beats formal training in my book.
I know the dangers.
I'm up for anything.
Don't underestimate the admiral. He's experienced, ruthless and, worst of all, smart.
Sarkus and I will wait for your signal. We'll be ready.
I was starting to get worried. There's a lot of Imperial movement going on up there.
Sarkus sabotaged a few things to keep them busy.
All part of the plan.
I took care of it.
I'm alive, so I won't complain that you didn't mention my help. Iain Sarkus, Hawkeye tech.
That's the result of some pointless experiments.
Blame the Hawkeye.
Iain Sarkus, sir. I left the Empire a few thank you presents for their hospitality.
Sarkus works at a well-armed, auxiliary satellite station used to spy on the locals. There's an armory on site and plenty of Imperial troops.
He reports to one of the Empire's best, Admiral Riserre. No wonder they've got control.
That sounds like firsthand experience talking.
So you've faced him before.
Fighting the admiral's like going up against a durasteel wall.
Should I be worried?
Does this change things?
You should be careful. The only way to beat Admiral Riserre is to stay one step ahead.
He won't get in my way.
I don't advocate wholesale slaughter, but this whole plan goes belly up if Admiral Riserre finds out.
Do what you have to and get Sarkus back to the shuttle pad. He'll tell us where to go from there.
Shouldn't take much.
Let's hope so. We're not going to get another shot at this.
I'm on my way now.
If Sarkus is willing to help, we'll be there.
We'll see about that.
Let's hope we're not risking our necks for a traitor.
We better be careful.
I'll make sure he's on the level.
We better be careful.
Sarkus is too smart to join the Empire. Or he better be.
I'll be standing by.
Commander Madine? I've recovered your intel. The agent didn't make it.
Even so, that's the best news I've gotten in a while. There's enough data here to build another satellite system...
...and it's all in Balmorran shorthand. Looks like the system's operated by the Hawkeye techs.
The Hawkeyes are the best technicians on Balmorra. To control the satellite system, we'll need their help.
How do we know they'll want to help?
If they're on our side.
I doubt the occupation's made them warm to the Empire.
Where do I find them?
The best people wouldn't work for the Empire.
Can't be that smart.
Not everyone's lucky enough to have the Force, Master Jedi.
We can't all make Havoc Squad, Captain.
A gun to your head makes a pretty persuasive argument.
Most of the Hawkeyes are stationed at the satellite control tower, but there's one we might be able to reach.
Iain Sarkus... I recognize the name. He's young, but brilliant. Bit of a wisecracker.
A Jedi learns to clear the mind of all distractions.
That won't bother me.
I'm more worried that he'll distract the Empire.
This could get dangerous. I don't want the kid to get hurt.
A civ? Are you sure?
If he's willing to help, he's accepting the risk--just like you and me.
I'd say he's met his match.
We'll get along swell.
On that, we agree.
He's all we've got.
We'll make do. The Republic always has.
He'll behave. I can promise you that.
I'll set him straight.
[This comm station is inactive.]
Reporting in, Commander. We made it back safely.
